result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawna Marie Powless

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Shawna Marie Powless
Current: PO Box 262, Odanah, WI 54861 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2017)
Prior: 77895 Birch Hill Lane,  P O Box 262, Odanah, WI 54861

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF55,16CF57. Agreement from parties. 16CF55 with be DRI. 16CF57 the def will pleas G/NC to counts 1,2,4 any remaining counts will be DRI. Understands charges and penalties. PLEADS NC to each count. admits she is a repeater. COunt 3,5,and 6 are DRI. and case 16CF55 is DRI. Signed PQ. Understands PQ. no threat or force to plead nc. No mind altering substances. Understands elements of each crime. Wants court to accept pleas of NC. Ct accepts plea and finds G.  State complied with vic rights. State filed motion to allow crim convictions which sets forth def's prior history. Ct reviewed motion- Atty comments that the recommendation is appropriate  Does think she has 29 days of sentence credit, both state and atty agree to this. Has been a good inmate. Def comments - wants to change and get home to children. not working right now- from brian injury. Ct agrees with agreement. Ct might go lighter in the jail sentence. Ct orders EAch CT   SENTENCING - withheld sentence of 18 months with conditions of: 60 days in jail, with 29 days credit, Work and child care release,   AODA and follow through, ABSOl, Pres as pres, Follow doctor orders,  UA, other Counseling , DNA, $10 fine and costs,CT 1 $567.63, CT 2 488.88, Ct4 499.80. no gun no vote. Payments be $20 a month beginning 2/25/17  from release from cust. Set current. 31 days left to serve.  Contra band seized ordered forf. Ct gives credit for being honest.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court, defendant Shawna Marie Powless not in court, in custody.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty comments needs to schd. maybe sometime Weds. DEF be here in person DA will tell jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Motion to allow admission of prior criminal convictions

Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Atty Perrine, def on probation hold, scheduled for treatment asks for another STC. DA request trial dates.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Argn in both cases, rec copy of each information, waives reading, stands mute.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def appr late approx 2hrs. Atty Perrine, child care and transportation issues. Warrants canceled, order to ff bond vacated.  Waives right to prelim. Ct finds prob cause, cases bound over. May leave state of WI for treatment  Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BOW on each case, bail/bond ff  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
